column4: *#*# I need some help .. when I type apt-get upgrade, I get the following message (on a fresh 8.04) install ... "Install these packages without verification [y/N]? " .. do I have a corrupted disk.. or someone trying to pull somthing funny on me ??

*#*# I need some help .. when I type apt-get upgrade, I get the following message (on a fresh 8.04) install ... "Install these packages without verification [y/N]? " .. do I have a corrupted disk.. or someone trying to pull somthing funny on me ?  Is this a matter of updating my md5sums somwhere..? anyone ..?

*#*# I need some help .. when I type apt-get upgrade, I get the following message (on a fresh 8.04) install ... "Install these packages without verification [y/N]? " .. do I have a corrupted disk.. or someone trying to pull somthing funny on me ?  Is this a matter of updating my md5sums somwhere..? anyone ..?
can you use http://pastebin.com   to give the output of: sudo apt-get update
you have added a repository, but not its GPG key
depends on the code thats output in the output, you can copy and paste to and from a terminal, you should use gnome-terminal
use the mouse to right click the selected text, then click copy
try: http://www.pastie.org
Pasted at http://www.pastie.org/698792 .. (thanks).
great. Thanks :). looks ok can you do the same with: sudo apt-get upgrade
http://www.pastie.org/698798 .. here is it ... thanks again.
is it any better if you run it as you user, rather than root (shouldnt make a difference but is worth exploring)
I tried it both ways... the results are some.
i'd say go for it but  log a bug
what are you trying to achieve exactly?
why during startup? It's not going to change between then and login....
sure but between the battery state and login it won't change, so running a command every 2 seconds or whatever will have zero difference
if you put the script where DrMax__ says then it will run at logon
i'll give you a script, gimme a sec
http://pastie.org/1045644    run: gksudo gedit /usr/bin/listpackages; chmod +x /usr/bin/listpackages     paste the text into the script, save the file and close gedit
then add the command /usr/bin/listpackages   to your startup items
